title: Azure
text: Ensure connected required VPNs Run setupAzureCreds(). ’ll prompted enter server, database, username password. securely stored operating system’s credential manager. update credentials use updateAzureCreds(). prompt fields change.
code: library(unifrog) #> Default ggplot theme set to unifrog_theme(). Unifrog colour palettes applied.

title: Azure
text: getAzureResults() function able query database, long connected VPN. default, query results also stored .parquet file data directory. example , data/query_name.parquet already exists query executed. Instead, .parquet file read using arrow::read_parquet() default behaviour can overridden , example, data query changed using overwrite = TRUE argument. Sometimes, might want change query passing function. case raw .sqlquery must first formatted using helper functions glue readr. example first read sql script. Next modify script. script must ‘glued’ passing function.
code:
query <- "queries/query_name.sql" results <- getAzureResults(   SQLscript = query ) results #>    student_keyno student_year_of_graduation #> 1          12691                       2018 #> 2          13019                       2020 #> 3          13021                       2020 #> 4          14288                       2050 #> 5          14665                       2024 #> 6          14666                       2021 #> 7          14668                       2022 #> 8          14669                       2022 #> 9          14671                       2020 #> 10         14672                       2050 #> 11         14674                       2022 #> 12         14675                       2019 #> 13         15340                       2018 #> 14         15925                       2018 #> 15         15928                       2020 #> 16         18165                       2017 #> 17         18372                       2023 #> 18         27878                       2017 #> 19         27894                       2020 #> 20         27991                       2017 results <- getAzureResults(   SQLscript = query,   output = "data/query_name.parquet",   overwrite = TRUE ) results library(readr) query_text <- read_file("queries/query_name.sql") query_text #> [1] "SELECT TOP(20) student_keyno, student_year_of_graduation
FROM student
" library(stringr) modified <- query_text |>    str_replace("student_year_of_graduation", "student_school") modified #> [1] "SELECT TOP(20) student_keyno, student_school
FROM student
" library(glue) query <- glue_sql(modified) query #> <SQL> SELECT TOP(20) student_keyno, student_school #> FROM student results <- getAzureResults(   SQLscript = query,   output = "data/query_results2.parquet",   glued = FALSE ) results #>    student_keyno student_school #> 1         158341            248 #> 2         158342            543 #> 3         158343            543 #> 4         158344            581 #> 5         158345            248 #> 6         158346            531 #> 7         158347            498 #> 8         158348            498 #> 9         158349            498 #> 10        158350            498 #> 11        158351            498 #> 12        158352            498 #> 13        158353            498 #> 14        158354            498 #> 15        158355            498 #> 16        158356            498 #> 17        158357            498 #> 18        158358            116 #> 19        158359            116 #> 20        158360            269

title: Palettes
text: extracts unifrog palette colours hex codes. Examples .
code: unifrog_colors() #>       pink0       pink1       pink2        pink    darkpink     orange0  #>   "#feddef"   "#fcabd8"   "#fb85c6"   "#f95cb3"   "#be5787"   "#ffe4cc"  #>     orange1     orange2      orange  darkorange     yellow0     yellow1  #>   "#ffc999"   "#ffaf67"   "#ff7901"   "#af5d13"   "#fff2cc"   "#ffe699"  #>     yellow2      yellow  darkyellow      green0      green1      green2  #>   "#ffd966"   "#ffc000"   "#d88300"   "#cdf3e6"   "#adebd6"   "#85e0c2"  #>       green   darkgreen       teal0       teal1       teal2        teal  #>   "#33cc99"   "#188f67"   "#c9f0ef"   "#b7e9e9"   "#93ddde"   "#4bc7c8"  #>    darkteal       blue0       blue1       blue2        blue    darkblue  #>   "#348b8b"   "#dae9f6"   "#bdd7ee"   "#9dc3e6"   "#5b9bd5"   "#167ad5"  #>     indigo0     indigo1     indigo2      indigo  darkindigo     purple0  #>   "#e8e9fe"   "#dbddfd"   "#bcbffc"   "#9ba0fb"   "#4f58fc"   "#ecdff5"  #>     purple1     purple2      purple  darkpurple  background neutralgrey  #>   "#ddc5ed"   "#cba7e3"   "#bd90dc"   "#9036d6"   "#Ffffff"   "#F9f9f9"  #>   lightgrey    darkgrey        main  #>   "#CCCCCC"   "#999999"   "#000000" unifrog_colors("green", "teal", "darkgrey") #> [1] "#33cc99" "#4bc7c8" "#999999"

title: Palettes
text: can view palettes pretty way using unikn package     grouped three categories: Discrete - ‘unifrog_main’ Sequential - ‘unifrog_blues’, ‘unifrog_greens’, ‘unifrog_oranges’, ‘unifrog_reds’ Diverging - ‘likert3’, ‘likert5’, ‘likert7’
code: library(unikn) #> Welcome to unikn (v0.8.0)! #> citation('unikn') provides citation information. seecol(unifrog_colors(), main = "The entire Unifrog colour scheme") seecol(unifrog_main, main = "The \"main\" palette is default for discrete data") seecol(likert3, main = "The \"likert3\" palette is default for continuous data") seecol(unifrog_palettes,   main = "The names of all of the Unifrog palettes",   pal_names = names(unifrog_palettes) )

title: Palettes
text: fill specified, categorical variable, default scale_fill_unifrog_d("unifrog_main").  can see addition line 4 effect output  Addition reverse = TRUE line 4 starts opposite end palette.  order guarantee colour reversal unifrog_main use fct_rev fill argument.  want use different palette, can specify palette argument. Note sequential palette often make sense bar charts.
code: ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_classic() ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_classic() +   scale_fill_unifrog_d() ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_classic() +   scale_fill_unifrog_d(reverse = TRUE) ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = fct_rev(Species))) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_classic() +   scale_fill_unifrog_d() ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_violin() +   scale_fill_unifrog_d(palette = "unifrog_teals") +   theme_classic()

title: Palettes
text: continuous variables, default scale_fill_unifrog_c("likert3")  can change way shown using color aesthetic.
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = hwy)) +   geom_point() +   unifrog_theme() ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = hwy)) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_unifrog_c("likert5") +   unifrog_theme()

title: Unifrog Data Team Helpers
text: goal provide set function help production documents reproducible research Unifrog House Style. contains three main parts: Functions interaction Azure database, including secure way store credentials using keyring package. corporate ggplot2 theme Unifrog - unifrog_theme() Corporate colour palettes including discrete, sequential diverging versions.

what: Connect to the Azure Database and Run a Query — getAzureResults
title: Connect to the Azure Database and Run a Query — getAzureResults
text: overwrite = FALSE output file already exists, database queried .parquet read instead. glued = FALSE, SQLscript raw .sql file, function automatically process .sql appropriate format. want modify script querying, example changing parameter, set glued = TRUE. case, ensure SQL script transformed glue_sql() passing function.

title: Connect to the Azure Database and Run a Query — getAzureResults
code: getAzureResults(SQLscript, output = NULL, overwrite = FALSE, glued = FALSE)

title: Connect to the Azure Database and Run a Query — getAzureResults
text: SQLscript object containing SQL script output string containing path .parquet output, defaults '/data/sql_file_name.parquet' overwrite logical indicating whether output .parquet overwritten. Defaults FALSE. glued logical indicating whether SQLscript glued.

title: Connect to the Azure Database and Run a Query — getAzureResults
Unifrog likert3 palette — likert3

what: Fix code for Apple Silicon Macs — macfixAzure

Fix code for Apple Silicon Macs — macfixAzure
Unifrog colour palette — palette_unifrog
text: palette based colours Unifrog tools shown tool.tool_hex Azure.

title: Unifrog colour palette — palette_unifrog
text: palette Character name palette. Depending color scale, can `"main"` (default, discrete), `"likert3"`, `"likert5"`, `"likert7"` diverging scales. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. ... Additional arguments pass [`colorRampPalette()`][colorRampPalette].

title: Unifrog colour palette — scale_color_unifrog
text: palette based colours Unifrog tools shown tool.tool_hex Azure. Use `scale_color_unifrog_d` *discrete* categories `scale_color_unifrog_c` *continuous* scale.

title: Unifrog colour palette — scale_color_unifrog
code: scale_color_unifrog(   palette = "unifrog_main",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "color",   ... )  scale_color_unifrog_d(   palette = "unifrog_main",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "color",   ... )  scale_color_unifrog_c(   palette = "likert3",   discrete = FALSE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "color",   ... )  scale_colour_unifrog(   palette = "unifrog_main",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "color",   ... )  scale_colour_unifrog_c(   palette = "likert3",   discrete = FALSE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "color",   ... )  scale_colour_unifrog_d(   palette = "unifrog_main",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "color",   ... )  scale_fill_unifrog(   palette = "unifrog_main",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "fill",   ... )  scale_fill_unifrog_d(   palette = "unifrog_main",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "fill",   ... )  scale_fill_unifrog_c(   palette = "likert3",   discrete = FALSE,   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = "fill",   ... )

title: Unifrog colour palette — scale_color_unifrog
text: palette Character name palette. Depending color scale, can `"main"` (default, discrete), `"likert3"`, `"likert5"`, `"likert7"` diverging scales. discrete Boolean indicating whether color aesthetic discrete . reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. aesthetics vector names aesthetics scale applied (e.g., `c('color', 'fill')`). ... Additional arguments passed `discrete_scale()` `discrete` `TRUE` `scale_color_gradientn()` `discrete` `FALSE`.

title: Unifrog colour palette — scale_color_unifrog
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_boxplot() +   scale_fill_unifrog_d() +   theme_bw()   ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_violin() +   scale_fill_unifrog_d(palette = "likert3") +   theme_bw()   ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, color = Sepal.Length)) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_unifrog_c(palette = "likert7") +   theme_bw()
